title: Alchemy
data:
***Version [0.32](/0.32 "0.32")**: This article is up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of *Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup*.*

The **Alchemy** school focuses on inflicting poison and altering your surroundings. Despite its name, no Alchemy spells affect items in any way.

## Contents

- [1 Aptitudes](#Aptitudes)

- [2 Spells](#Spells)

  - [2.1 Level 1](#Level_1)
  - [2.2 Level 2](#Level_2)
  - [2.3 Level 3](#Level_3)
  - [2.4 Level 4](#Level_4)
  - [2.5 Level 5](#Level_5)
  - [2.6 Level 6](#Level_6)
  - [2.7 Level 8](#Level_8)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 See Also](#See_Also)

- [5 History](#History)

| [![Fulsome fusillade.png](/images/0/0f/Fulsome_fusillade.png)](/File:Fulsome_fusillade.png)                                | [Fulsome Fusillade](/Fulsome_Fusillade "Fulsome Fusillade")                              | Alchemy/[Conjuration](/Conjurations "Conjurations")                               | 8     | 200       | 8     | 8     | Area, Chaotic, Destructive               | [Book of Spectacle](/Book_of_Spectacle "Book of Spectacle") [Book of Transmutation](/Book_of_Transmutation "Book of Transmutation")                                                               |

## Strategy

- Many Alchemy spells can be considered as "side" spells. They often have a major limitation, but come with strong/useful effects to compensate.
  - For example, Irradiate has only 1 range, and can only be used a few times in a row safely, but can otherwise tear apart enemies. Most of the [poison](/Poison "Poison")-themed spells do little against foes with [poison resistance](/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance"), but are great against foes without.
- Most of Alchemist's starting spells are strong, but don't do much against foes with [poison resistance](/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance"). Sticky Flame can be used to take out rPois monsters, though as a level 4 spell, it'll take a while to use consistently.

## See Also

- [Alchemist](/Alchemist "Alchemist")

## History

- In [0.32](/0.32 "0.32"), [Cigotuvi's Dreadful Rot](/Cigotuvi%27s_Dreadful_Rot "Cigotuvi's Dreadful Rot") was removed, and [Hoarfrost Cannonade](/Hoarfrost_Cannonade "Hoarfrost Cannonade") and [Fulsome Fusillade](/Fulsome_Fusillade "Fulsome Fusillade") were added.
- In [0.31](/0.31 "0.31"), Alchemy was introduced, replacing [Poison Magic](/Poison_Magic "Poison Magic") and part of [Transmutations](/Transmutations "Transmutations").

html:
Alchemy

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.32: This article is up to date for the latest stable release of Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup.

The Alchemy school focuses on inflicting poison and altering your surroundings. Despite its name, no Alchemy spells affect items in any way.

Contents

  • 1 Aptitudes
  • 2 Spells
    • 2.1 Level 1
    • 2.2 Level 2
    • 2.3 Level 3
    • 2.4 Level 4
    • 2.5 Level 5
    • 2.6 Level 6
    • 2.7 Level 8
  • 3 Strategy
  • 4 See Also
  • 5 History

Aptitudes

At Ba Co DE Dg Ds Dj Dr Fe Fo Gr Gh Gn Hu Ko Mf Mi MD Mu Na Op On Sp Te Tr Vp VS
-1 1 1 1 -1 0 11 0 -1 3 -2 -1 6 0 0 3 -3 -2 -2 2 1 -1 1 -1 -3 1 0
  • Green draconians get 2.


Spells

Icon Name Schools Level Power
cap 		Range Noise Flags Books

Level 1

Sting Alchemy/Conjuration 1 25 3 1 Dir or target, Needs tracer Book of Cantrips
Young Poisoner's Handbook

Level 2

Mercury Vapours Air/Alchemy 2 50 3 2 Not self, Target Book of Vapours
Young Poisoner's Handbook

Level 3

Mephitic Cloud Air/Alchemy/Conjuration 3 100 4 15 Area, Cloud, Dir or target, Needs tracer Book of the Senses
Book of Vapours

Level 4

Fulminant Prism Alchemy/Conjuration 4 200 4 4 Area, Not self, Target Book of Blasting
Book of Conjurations
Ignite Poison Alchemy/Fire 4 100 4 Area Everburning Encyclopedia
Trismegistus Codex

Young Poisoner's Handbook
Petrify Alchemy/Earth 4 100 6 3 Wl check, Dir or target, Needs tracer Book of Sloth
Book of Transmutation
Sticky Flame Alchemy/Fire 4 100 1 4 Dir or target, Needs tracer Everburning Encyclopedia
Book of Flames

Level 5

Alistair's Intoxication Alchemy 5 150 3 Great Wizards, Vol. II
Book of Party Tricks
Hoarfrost Cannonade Alchemy/Ice 5 200 5 Compendium of Siegecraft
Book of Winter
Irradiate Alchemy/Conjuration 5 200 1 4 Area, Chaotic Book of Spontaneous Combustion
Book of Transmutation
Yara's Violent Unravelling Alchemy/Hexes 5 200 LOS 15 Chaotic, No ghost, Target Great Wizards, Vol. VII
Book of Misfortune

Level 6

Eringya's Noxious Bog Alchemy 6 200 4 6 Area, No ghost Fen Folio
Great Wizards, Vol. II
Sculpt Simulacrum Alchemy/Ice 6 200 1 6 Dir or target, Needs tracer Book of Ice
Book of the Tundra
Book of Winter

Level 8

Fulsome Fusillade Alchemy/Conjuration 8 200 8 8 Area, Chaotic, Destructive Book of Spectacle
Book of Transmutation

Strategy

  • Many Alchemy spells can be considered as "side" spells. They often have a major limitation, but come with strong/useful effects to compensate.
    • For example, Irradiate has only 1 range, and can only be used a few times in a row safely, but can otherwise tear apart enemies. Most of the poison-themed spells do little against foes with poison resistance, but are great against foes without.
  • Most of Alchemist's starting spells are strong, but don't do much against foes with poison resistance. Sticky Flame can be used to take out rPois monsters, though as a level 4 spell, it'll take a while to use consistently.

See Also

  • Alchemist

History

  • In 0.32, Cigotuvi's Dreadful Rot was removed, and Hoarfrost Cannonade and Fulsome Fusillade were added.
  • In 0.31, Alchemy was introduced, replacing Poison Magic and part of Transmutations.

rawPage:
{{version032}}

The '''Alchemy''' school focuses on inflicting poison and altering your surroundings. Despite its name, no Alchemy spells affect items in any way.

{{skill aptitudes}}

{{spell table by level|Alchemy}}

==Strategy==
*Many Alchemy spells can be considered as "side" spells. They often have a major limitation, but come with strong/useful effects to compensate.
**For example, Irradiate has only 1 range, and can only be used a few times in a row safely, but can otherwise tear apart enemies. Most of the [[poison]]-themed spells do little against foes with [[poison resistance]], but are great against foes without.
*Most of Alchemist's starting spells are strong, but don't do much against foes with [[poison resistance]]. Sticky Flame can be used to take out rPois monsters, though as a level 4 spell, it'll take a while to use consistently.

==See Also==
*[[Alchemist]]

==History==
*In [[0.32]], [[Cigotuvi's Dreadful Rot]] was removed, and [[Hoarfrost Cannonade]] and [[Fulsome Fusillade]] were added. 
*In [[0.31]], Alchemy was introduced, replacing [[Poison Magic]] and part of [[Transmutations]].

{{Skills}}

[[Category:Magic skills]] [[Category:Alchemy Spells]]
